Add two registers.description: ADD two registers and put the result in the destination register.

Add a register and an immediate value.description: ADD a register and an immediate value between -16 and 15 and put the result in the destination register.

And two registers.description: AND two registers and put the result in the destination register.

And a register and an immediate value.description: AND a register and an immediate value between -16 and 15 and put the result in the destination register.

Not a register.description: NOT a register and put the result in the destination register.

Load.description: Load the contents of the memory address specified by the PC plus an offset value between -256 and 255 to the destination register.

Load relative.description: Load the contents of the memory address specified by the memory address given in the base register plus an offest value between -64 and 63 to the desitnation register.

Load immediate.description: Load the contents of the memory address specified by the value stored at the memory address pointed to by the PC plus an offset value between -256 and 255 to the destination register.

Store.description: Store the contents of the source register to the memory address specified by the PC plus an offset value between -256 and 255.

Store relative.description: Store the contents of the source register to the memory address specified by the memory address given in the base register plus an offest value between -64 and 63.

Store immediate.description: Store the contents of the source register to the memory address specified by the value stored at the memory address pointed to by the PC plus an offset value between -256 and 255.

Load effective address.description: Load the memory address specified by the PC plus an offset value between -256 and 255. (NOTE: NOT the value stored, the actual address)

Break.description: Sets the PC to the memory address specified by the PC plus an offset value between -256 and 255 if the condition codes in the PSR match the operation statement.

Jump.description: Sets the PC to the value stored in the specified source register.

Return.description: Sets the PC to the value stored in register 7.

Jump to subroutine.description: Stores the current PC into register 7 and sets the PC to the address specified by the current PC plus an offset value between -1024 and 1023.

Jump to sobroutine register.description: Stores the current PC into register 7 and sets the PC to the value of the specified source register.

System call.description: Call one of the available subroutines. Available trapvect values are: x20, x21, x22, x23, and x25, corresponding to GETC, OUT, PUTS, IN, and HALT.

Origin and End.description: Tells the assembler where the program begins and ends.

Fill.description: Fills the memory location with the value specifiec.

String.description: Creates a null-terminated string starting at the location of the command. Note that this will take up n+1 memory locations given a string of size n.

Block Word.description: Sets aside the specified number of memory locations for use later. Often used with labels.
